channel.title: Making A Server Public
channel.description:
Hello everyone I am having a very "odd" problem you may say. Basically I port-fowarded, got the no-ip and all that good stuff. When I run the server and check its status RL says it is online. I can connect to it when I put the IP to "127.0.0.1" in my Client.java, but I cannot connect to it when I change the IP to the "No-Ip". I am connecting to it through the same PC I am hosting it on, so I would assume I would use 127.0.0.1, and the JAR that OTHER people will use will contain the "No-Ip"? If this is the case I tried to connect to it through my laptop and could not do so. The laptop client had the "no-ip" in client.java.
If anyone could enlighten me on what is going on and what I will have to do so some friends can get on, please let me know.

item.title: Making A Server Public
item.dc:creator: @rich_noob_xd rich noob xd
item.description:
@rich_noob_xd wrote:

I tried this with my laptop. How ever it has the same IP as my laptop. I used the No-Ip on my laptop and could not connect to my PC. Is that because it is the same IP? I am a little confused on that subject. Any help would be appreciated, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Making A Server Public
item.dc:creator: @qtst35 qtst35
item.description:
@qtst35 wrote:

its fine dont worry about it the client you release to the public make it your no-ip but the client you have keep it 127.0.0.1

you will connect to the same 1 because thier connecting to your comp and ur using ur comps local host

hope this works

Read full topic

item.title: Making A Server Public
item.dc:creator: @rich_noob_xd rich noob xd
item.description:
@rich_noob_xd wrote:

Hello everyone I am having a very “odd” problem you may say. Basically I port-fowarded, got the no-ip and all that good stuff. When I run the server and check its status RL says it is online. I can connect to it when I put the IP to “127.0.0.1” in my Client.java, but I cannot connect to it when I change the IP to the “No-Ip”. I am connecting to it through the same PC I am hosting it on, so I would assume I would use 127.0.0.1, and the JAR that OTHER people will use will contain the “No-Ip”? If this is the case I tried to connect to it through my laptop and could not do so. The laptop client had the “no-ip” in client.java.

If anyone could enlighten me on what is going on and what I will have to do so some friends can get on, please let me know.
